edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.world

Class Switch

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.Element
      • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.world.Tile
        • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.world.Switch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Switch
extends Tile
    Enables Tile objects to switch off from being active and inactive so Switch animation is possible
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.Element

        bounds, height, position, width

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Switch(int x, int y, World w)
      Calls Tile constructor to create an instance of rectangle object to set bounds and make TileType.SWITCH an instance variable of class Tile, creates two instances of ArrayList type point that categorizes tiles as active or inactive and makes w an instance variable of Switch Class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void active()
      Recycles active and inactive tile objects so different animations arepossible
      void addActiveTile(int x, int y)
      Adds a new instance of tile to activeTile ArrayList
      void addInactiveTile(int x, int y)
      Adds a new instance of tile to inactiveTile ArrayList
      void drawIt(java.awt.Graphics2D win)
      Overrides the drawIt function to draw the switch animation
      void update()
      Runs enchanced for loop to get inactive and active tiles on instance of World object; background tile objects are inactive Tiles and steelX tile objects are active Tiles

      • Methods inherited from class edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.world.Tile

        getTileType

      • Methods inherited from class edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.game.alva.Element

        getBounds, getHeight, getPosition, getWidth, setHeight, setPosition, setWidth

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Switch

        public Switch(int x,
              int y,
              World w)
        Calls Tile constructor to create an instance of rectangle object to set bounds and make TileType.SWITCH an instance variable of class Tile, creates two instances of ArrayList type point that categorizes tiles as active or inactive and makes w an instance variable of Switch Class
        Parameters:
        x - Vector2 object x position
        y - Vector2 object y position
        w - passes object of type World to be made into instance variable of Switch Class

    • Method Detail

      • addActiveTile

        public void addActiveTile(int x,
                          int y)
        Adds a new instance of tile to activeTile ArrayList
        Parameters:
        x - int value of x position of new tile
        y - int value of y position of new tile

      • addInactiveTile

        public void addInactiveTile(int x,
                            int y)
        Adds a new instance of tile to inactiveTile ArrayList
        Parameters:
        x - int value of x position of new tile
        y - int value of y position of new tile

      • active

        public void active()
        Recycles active and inactive tile objects so different animations arepossible

      • update

        public void update()
        Runs enchanced for loop to get inactive and active tiles on instance of World object; background tile objects are inactive Tiles and steelX tile objects are active Tiles

      • drawIt

        public void drawIt(java.awt.Graphics2D win)
        Overrides the drawIt function to draw the switch animation
        Overrides:
        drawIt in class Tile
        Parameters:
        win - Graphics2D object that represents the window object for drawing to a GUI
